text:
Pt. is an 80y.o. male admitted last evening from [**Hospital3 474**] with
   cholangitis and sepsis.  CC: 4-5 days nausea/vomiting and weakness.
   Pt. had fever and noted that he
was yellow
 and reported to ED.
   Pt. was admitted to [**Hospital Unit Name 10**] and urgently transported to GI suite for ERCP
   last evening.
   Sepsis without organ dysfunction
   Assessment:
   Afebrile. Tmax 98.2 oral.   Remains intubated , vented . On sedation
   with fentanyl and versed.
   Lactate , WBC . CVP at start of shift was around [**10-30**], later started
   trending down to 7.
   U/O above 30cc/hr.
    Pt continues on levophed , was on 0.25mcg/kg/min at start of shift. ,
   Bp maintaining around low 100
s systolic. currently on 0.3mcg/kg/min.
   Action:
   Pt is on vanc, zosyn and cipro. Pt was given

   Cholangitis
